page.title: 01Porthpean area
page.content: This is an area of undulating countryside which reaches the coast in a series of sandy bays interrupting shell and slate cliffs. There were tin mines here,though now farming and tourism are the principle activities. Two roads traverse the district from North to South,the B3273,which carries most traffic,especially during tourist season,follows the wooded valley of the White River. The second is a minor road used by local traffic. There are two small hamlets-London Apprentice and Lower Porthpean-though the area is devoted mainly to farming. New building is severely restricted. Inhabitants depend upon St.Austell for most amenities and jobs.
